instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-2936 short fan spin on charger only, runs on battery
threads.message: This board ran on battery but had no green light. Found corrosion around Q5310 and that edge of the board and had .7V at SMC BC ACOK. Replaced Q5310 and got green light and PPBUS G3H and short fan spin but stops... PPBUS G3H stays steady at 12.62V once connected to power and after fan starts and stops.

threads.title: 820-2936 short fan spin on charger only, runs on battery
threads.message: Does it start in SMC bypass mode?

threads.title: 820-2936 short fan spin on charger only, runs on battery
threads.message: It DOES. Never used that to test before... what does that imply? AFter poking around the posts a bit... being it runs ok on battery does this mean then that SMC current sensing related to the charging circuit is awry?

threads.title: 820-2936 short fan spin on charger only, runs on battery
threads.message:
Most likely.
Check resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28 of U7000.
Also check SMC_DCIN/PBUS_VSENSE and SMC_DCIN/BMON_ISENSE.

threads.title: 820-2936 short fan spin on charger only, runs on battery
threads.message:
85w Charger only  connected:
17/18 resistance 3.0 ohms 
27/28 20.9 ohms
dCIN VSENSE 2.8V
PBUS VSENSE 2.1V
DCIN ISENSE 0V
BMON ISENSE 3.4V

threads.title: 820-2936 short fan spin on charger only, runs on battery
threads.message:
"BMON ISENSE 3.4V"
Too high value; post CHGR_BMON level.

threads.title: 820-2936 short fan spin on charger only, runs on battery
820-2936 short fan spin on charger only, runs on battery
threads.message: Check the circuit between CHGR_BMON and SMC_BMON _ISENSE.

threads.title: 820-2936 short fan spin on charger only, runs on battery
threads.message: damnit I must've tested wrong spot before for BMON_ISENSE its 0V. OY! sorry

threads.title: 820-2936 short fan spin on charger only, runs on battery
threads.message:
Aaaah, you get short fan spin in normal mode.
Then must be a SMC sensor from other rail.
Check all other sensor circuits from pages 49/50.
I bet for some corroded trace, or resistor.

threads.title: 820-2936 short fan spin on charger only, runs on battery
threads.message: being that it runs on battery that would mean problem in related to the DCIN sensors right?

threads.title: 820-2936 short fan spin on charger only, runs on battery
threads.message:
Shouldn't be DCIN sensor, as it tries to start in normal mode.
DCIN and PBUS sensors look good also.

threads.title: 820-2936 short fan spin on charger only, runs on battery
threads.message: lost a pad on the smc trying to reball it. DOn't have another 2936 board! I'll have to put this one on the shelf until I get a SMC for it. I was thinking it had to be SMC related being the battery op runs fine and charger sensors seem to be reading correctly? Idk. I couldn't identify any sensor issues related to the pages you referenced but I'll try again once I get SMC back on it.
